column4: btw, anyone know why ubuntu takes ages to load the network configuration on start up??
is your network IP determined by DHCP?

ah okay, there are some ethernet adaptors that take a while to be set to an IP address for some reason... If you've experienced (if you've run Windows) that your network wouldn't start up after until 2 minutes after you started Windows, it's not a problem with Ubuntu, but with your router, NIC, or ISP.
you might not notice it in Windows because it does not initialize network before it boots the graphical interface
